properties.name: Defective Part Disposal Rule
properties.description: Defective parts held by the Organisation that are property of OmniTruck are to be disposed of properly after approval by OmniTruck. This deadline may be shortened in consultation with OmniTruck.

properties.name: Field Processing Agreement (FPA)
properties.description: An agreement to adjust the 'Additional Costs' surcharge for high-priced products. It is automatically extended yearly unless a review is requested.

properties.name: Billing Objection Rule for 0-mile Complaints
properties.description: The Organisation shall inform the Customer in writing about objections to 0-mile complaint costs via the eBilling system.

properties.name: Technical Documents
properties.description: Technical documents for specific products, such as works standards, installation drawings/assembly drawings, component requirement specifications.

properties.name: eQS Validation Routine
properties.description: A documented validation routine must be performed by the Organisation after relevant staff changes, but at least twice per year in the eQS application, to ensure accuracy of information and contact persons.

properties.name: Spare Parts Agreement Requirement
properties.description: For spare parts, a mutual agreement regarding quality framework certifications must be negotiated individually.

properties.name: 100% Functional Check Requirement
properties.description: Each delivered unit relevant to safety, legal requirements, and function must undergo a 100% functional check. The quality assurance concept for this must be agreed upon with OmniTruck.

properties.name: Know-How Exclusion Rule
properties.description: Documents containing Apex Components-specific know-how shall be excluded from the transfer of sampling documents. They can be viewed by OmniTruck at the facility in special cases.

properties.name: Special Production Equipment
properties.description: Tooling that is 100% paid by the Customer.

properties.name: Defective Part Analysis Cost Rule
properties.description: Following the legal duty of field data observation, both the Organisation and OmniTruck shall bear the costs incurred from the defective part analysis itself.

properties.name: Requalification Rule
properties.description: Specific for OmniTruck, requalification shall be performed by product family as defined by the Organisation.

properties.name: No Trouble Found (NTF) process
properties.description: A joint process to investigate complaints where the root cause is not understood after initial part analysis. If the complaint is still not understood, a commercial agreement for cost sharing is made.

properties.name: Field Claim Billing Frequency Rule
properties.description: The Customer will claim costs due to defective parts regularly, but at least twice per calendar year.
properties.frequency: at least twice per calendar year

properties.description: Apex reserves the right to relocate production during the nomination period until 2033, contingent on future cost developments in the USA.

properties.comment: In series production, materials and manufacturing are planned based on OmniTruck's 12-month delivery schedules. The frozen zone is typically 7-9 working weeks.

properties.description: Labor costs for repair and/or replacement of the defective goods (e.g., removal and installation costs). The average value of time and hourly rate are to be agreed upon in writing.

properties.description: Costs for consequential damages on the vehicle for which the Organisation is responsible. A mutually agreed solution will be sought per case.

properties.name: Serial Defect Definition (OT)
properties.description: Definition of a serial defect for OmniTruck Corporation, with specific failure rate thresholds.

metadata.chunk_id: 4.8.7 Serial complaints and recall actions on road safety reasons

properties.reason: Clashes between the fork roller and releaser sliding sleeve were noted in a worst-case scenario: -0.18mm. Both parties have assessed this minor overlap as non-critical due to its low probability of occurrence.

It is not possible for the fork to pass the sliding sleeve of the releaser. This is caused by the reduced range of motion of the fork. The piston situated between both forks interferes with the Nordic Haulers Model 700-H housing.
Standard 25 compliance will be negotiated separately; however, inscriptions consistent with previous projects are possible.
Fatigue and wear lifetime details provided, field testing required for verification.

properties.condition: For non-manufacturing Organizations, or manufacturing Organizations supplying parts for special uses.
In the event of overlapping content with other agreements and guidelines.
